title: Effective Language Education Design Through Analysis of Lecture Evaluations and Class Size Impact

context.prior_knowledge: Experience in basic language education operations and ability to utilize assessment tools
context.additional_context: A process where in-service professionals simulate and analyze the correlation between changes in class size and assessment outcomes in real-world language education settings via VR/simulation environments.

learning_goals: The quantitative impact of increased class size on lecture evaluation scores by category can be analyzed.
Learner experience differences in small-scale and large-scale classroom environments can be compared through VR simulations.
Practical strategies can be developed to mitigate evaluation discrepancies caused solely by class size without altering lecture design.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
